title: Job Vacancies at Evans Industries
content:
Evans Industries is a manufacturing company, established over 20 years ago. Our purpose is to develop high quality home and personal care products at an affordable price. We are an ISO 90001 - 2015 certified company, therefore, all our operations comply with international standards. In admiration of the high quality products, Evans Industries products have become a household name and can be found across the country.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Graphic Designer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Graphics Manager is responsible for leading and supervising the creative team in developing high-quality visual designs for product packaging, brand materials, promotional content, and social media assets.
	The role ensures brand consistency across all platforms and supports the commercial team with compelling marketing visuals that reinforce the company’s identity and enhance market presence.


Key Responsibilities
Creative Direction & Team Leadership:


	Lead and mentor a team of graphic designers in producing high-impact visual assets for packaging, promotional campaigns, and digital platforms.
	Assign tasks, review artwork, and ensure design quality aligns with brand guidelines and marketing objectives.
	Conduct brainstorming sessions and provide feedback to drive creativity and continuous improvement.


Brand Identity & Consistency:


	Maintain and enforce visual brand standards across all communication materials.
	Ensure correct application of company logos, typography, and key imagery across departments and external partners.
	Collaborate with the product and marketing teams to develop cohesive brand narratives.


Packaging & Product Artwork Development:


	Oversee the end-to-end process of packaging design, artwork creation, and product mock-ups for personal care and household products.
	Review and approve print-ready files and collaborate with suppliers or printers to ensure production quality.


Marketing Support:


	Design and supervise the creation of marketing collateral such as posters, banners, brochures, in-store and outdoor promotional materials.
	Support digital marketing initiatives by ensuring timely development of engaging social media graphics and content layouts.


Project Management:


	Plan and manage design timelines, allocate resources, and ensure timely delivery of artwork.
	Coordinate with product development, sales, and marketing teams to prioritize requests and align outputs with commercial strategy.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Graphic Design, Fine Arts, Visual Communication, Marketing Communications, or related field.


Experience:


	Minimum of 5 - 7 years of professional graphic design experience, preferably within FMCG, cosmetics, personal care, or household products industry.
	At least 2–3 years of supervisory or managerial experience leading a design or creative team.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), CorelDraw, and other relevant design tools.


Application Closing Date: 29th November, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Delivery: Pick up and deliver packages, documents, and other items to specified locations promptly and securely. 
	Route planning: Plan and follow efficient routes to optimize delivery times. 
	Documentation: Obtain signatures, confirmations, or collect payments upon delivery. 
	Vehicle maintenance: Ensure the assigned vehicle is in good working condition and that all vehicle documents are up to date. 
	Safety: Adhere to all Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) policies and drive safely at all times. 
	Record keeping: Update logbooks and report on all matters related to the assigned motorcycle to a supervisor. 


Qualifications and Skills


	Education: An SSCE / WAEC qualification or higher is often the minimum educational requirement. 
	Valid license: Must possess a valid rider's/driver's card or license. 
	Experience: A minimum of one to two years of experience is often required. 
	Knowledge of routes: Must be familiar with local roads, often specified by city (e.g., Lagos routes). 
	Skills: Strong organizational and time management skills are essential. 
	Personal attributes: Must be punctual, reliable, honest, and able to work under minimal supervision. 
	Physical fitness: Able to handle the physical demands of the job, which may include long hours. 
	Communication: Good communication skills are necessary for interacting with customers and supervisors.


Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: careers@evansng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Soap Machine Operator

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Operate machine, efficiently, safely to achieve set target.
	Ensure machines are clean, maintained in accordance with good preventive maintenance culture.
	Regularly inspecting machine to identify any replacement malfunction and repair and report to appropriate Person.
	Ensure strong adherence to safety, quality and good manufacturing practices.
	Assist the technical team in carrying out periodic repair and maintenance.
	Ensure work area is clean, safe and organized.
	Contribute to waste reduction management programme.
	Assist the team in the overall company’s objective.
	Assist the supervisor and production manager in any job assigned to you. 
	Operate machine, efficiently, safely to achieve set target.


Application Closing Date: 30th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@evansng.com using the Job Posirtion as the subject of the email.

 

     

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "UI / UX Designer",
  "description": "At Axonvault Innovations, we are reimagining how the world creates, connects, and scales innovation. Too many groundbreaking ideas remain trapped in notebooks, while businesses and investors struggle to find disruptive solutions. We exist to bridge that gap &mdash; turning bold concepts into real-world impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: UI / UX Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We&rsquo;re looking for a UI/UX Designer who combines creativity with critical thinking &mdash; someone who can translate abstract concepts into intuitive, world-class user experiences.


What You&rsquo;ll Do


	Collaborate with product managers, developers, and innovation strategists to create user-centered designs.
	Turn complex workflows into simple, elegant, and functional interfaces.
	Conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to iterate designs.
	Design wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups for web and mobile products.
	Maintain and evolve AxonVault&rsquo;s design system and visual identity.
	Contribute ideas that enhance user engagement and emotional connection to our platform.


What You Bring


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree
	Proven experience (2+ years) designing intuitive interfaces for SaaS, marketplaces, or tech startups.
	Mastery of design tools like Figma, Adobe XD, or Sketch.
	Strong understanding of UX principles, accessibility, and responsive design.
	Ability to think like a product owner &mdash; beyond visuals, you understand user psychology.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills across multidisciplinary teams.
	A portfolio that demonstrates both creativity and clarity in design thinking.
	Must be resident in Abuja and able to start immediately.


Why Join AxonVault


	Be part of a bold innovation startup redefining how the world discovers and exchanges ideas.
	Collaborate with a global team of thinkers, creators, and technologists.
	Enjoy a culture that values experimentation, empathy, and personal growth.
	Competitive pay and potential equity opportunities as we scale.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to:&nbsp;axonvault@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;UI/UX Designer Application&quot; as the subject of the email.",

UI / UX Designer Job at Axonvault Innovations




        
    

        
        At Axonvault Innovations, we are reimagining how the world creates, connects, and scales innovation. Too many groundbreaking ideas remain trapped in notebooks, while businesses and investors struggle to find disruptive solutions. We exist to bridge that gap — turning bold concepts into real-world impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: UI / UX Designer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We’re looking for a UI/UX Designer who combines creativity with critical thinking — someone who can translate abstract concepts into intuitive, world-class user experiences.


What You’ll Do


	Collaborate with product managers, developers, and innovation strategists to create user-centered designs.
	Turn complex workflows into simple, elegant, and functional interfaces.
	Conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to iterate designs.
	Design wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups for web and mobile products.
	Maintain and evolve AxonVault’s design system and visual identity.
	Contribute ideas that enhance user engagement and emotional connection to our platform.


What You Bring


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree
	Proven experience (2+ years) designing intuitive interfaces for SaaS, marketplaces, or tech startups.
	Mastery of design tools like Figma, Adobe XD, or Sketch.
	Strong understanding of UX principles, accessibility, and responsive design.
	Ability to think like a product owner — beyond visuals, you understand user psychology.
	Excellent communication and collaboration skills across multidisciplinary teams.
	A portfolio that demonstrates both creativity and clarity in design thinking.
	Must be resident in Abuja and able to start immediately.


Why Join AxonVault


	Be part of a bold innovation startup redefining how the world discovers and exchanges ideas.
	Collaborate with a global team of thinkers, creators, and technologists.
	Enjoy a culture that values experimentation, empathy, and personal growth.
	Competitive pay and potential equity opportunities as we scale.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and portfolio to: axonvault@gmail.com using "UI/UX Designer Application" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Analyst",
  "description": "eHealth4everyone is a digital health enterprise based in Nigeria (Africa) contributing to health service delivery using data science and information technology. At ehealth4everyone, our goal is saving lives and our approach is information and technology. We believe that if health is a right, proven digital health solutions and expertise such as ours should not be a privilege.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type:Full-time

Job Summary


	The Data Analyst will lead and support the analysis of qualitative data collected from field officers, including health-care providers and community leaders.
	The Analyst will synthesize findings to inform the project coordinator and ensure that the voices of clients and providers are meaningfully represented in project outputs.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the analysis of qualitative data using established qualitative methods.
	Collaborate with field teams to ensure high-quality data collection and ethical standards.
	Conduct literature reviews and desk research to contextualize findings within existing evidence on PAC and reproductive health.
	Draft detailed analytical reports, case studies, and summaries for internal and external dissemination.
	Work closely with the research team to triangulate qualitative insights with quantitative findings.
	Ensure data privacy, confidentiality, and informed consent are maintained throughout the data life cycle.


Experience


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 3 - 5 years of experience.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-28",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "eHealth4everyone"
    
  },

Data Analyst Job at eHealth4everyone




        
    

        
        eHealth4everyone is a digital health enterprise based in Nigeria (Africa) contributing to health service delivery using data science and information technology. At ehealth4everyone, our goal is saving lives and our approach is information and technology. We believe that if health is a right, proven digital health solutions and expertise such as ours should not be a privilege.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type:Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Data Analyst will lead and support the analysis of qualitative data collected from field officers, including health-care providers and community leaders.
	The Analyst will synthesize findings to inform the project coordinator and ensure that the voices of clients and providers are meaningfully represented in project outputs.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the analysis of qualitative data using established qualitative methods.
	Collaborate with field teams to ensure high-quality data collection and ethical standards.
	Conduct literature reviews and desk research to contextualize findings within existing evidence on PAC and reproductive health.
	Draft detailed analytical reports, case studies, and summaries for internal and external dissemination.
	Work closely with the research team to triangulate qualitative insights with quantitative findings.
	Ensure data privacy, confidentiality, and informed consent are maintained throughout the data life cycle.


Experience


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications with 3 - 5 years of experience.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Electrical Project Engineer Job at Consultants Collaborative Partnership




        
    

        
        Consultants Collaborative Partnership is a one-stop shop for all the need in the built industry. We have under the umbrella of our company the service of Architects, Structural Engineers, Mechanical Engineers, Electrical Engineers and Project Managers. We are World Class Consultants in the Built Industry; having a quality management system in the delivery of allour designs to the delight of our client.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Project Engineer

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description / Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare drawing list and project work plan.
	To attend technical and coordination meetings.
	To ensure that all engineering site work are carried out to design specification.
	Prepare preliminary and final drawings to the delight of the client.
	Review engineering content with senior project engineer, departmental head and partners.
	Assist with conducting departmental and individual training as may be necessary.
	Resolve technical issues and establish patterns and practices for the department in collaboration with a senior project engineer or HOD.
	Respond in a courteous and prompt manner to all client questions, complaints and/or requests to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction and escalate where necessary.
	Promote teamwork and quality service through daily communication and coordination with other departments.
	Assist the firm’s Engineering expert such as senior project engineer, HOD and partners in representing the Firm in contract negotiations.
	Liaise with industry experts to integrate market specific considerations into the Firm’s Engineering library.


Qualification


	Bsc. Electrical Electronics
	Experience: Work Experience with a Reputable Engineering Consulting Firm- experience in Electrical & Eelctronic system design of industrial, commercial, hospitality and residential building.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
